messages.content: You are a helpful AI assistant.
How much distance can a character cover in one combat round?
8 meters

Can you decide the fate of a non-player character without a roll?
Yes, you can decide what happens to a non-player character
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What happens to a non-player character if an investigator punches it?
That character drops dead.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Can an investigator kill a non-player character without a roll?
Yes, if the investigator states they are killing the non-player character.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Do investigators always get a dice roll in a combat situation?
Yes, even if it's not directly affecting the investigator.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Can a non-player character be crushed by falling objects without a roll?
Yes, without a roll, as long as the object falls and affects the character.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What happens if an investigator has a non-player character at their mercy and states they are killing the non-player character?
The investigator can allow this to happen without using dice.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Can a player assess a non-player character's injuries by tracking the damage they inflict?
Yes, players can assess a non-player character's injuries by tracking the damage they inflict.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What happens when a successful First Aid or Medicine roll is performed on a non-player character?
The game should indicate to the player whether the non-player character is dying, dead, or alive.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Can a ceiling fall and crush a non-player character without a roll?
Yes, a ceiling fall and crush a non-player character without a roll, but the investigator will always get a dice roll.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What happens to an investigator when a non-player character is injured?
An investigator will always get a dice roll—in this case, perhaps to dodge falling masonry or to notice the loose ceiling before it falls.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
How do players assess a non-player character's injuries?
Players may assess a non-player character’s injuries by tracking the damage they inflict or simply by what the investigators perceive.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What happens to an enemy when reduced to unconsciousness?
The enemy will most likely recover, given time.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
Does a cold-blooded murder incur a Sanity roll?
In most cases, cold-blooded murder should incur a Sanity roll.

What should be done after a successful First Aid or Medicine roll on a non-player character?
Indicate to the player whether the non-player character is dying, dead, or alive.

What happens to an enemy reduced to unconsciousness?
The enemy will most likely recover given time.

What should be done in a chase when the player wins a Luck roll?
The player should describe the location, as part of the Keeper's role.

What happens when a player commits cold-blooded murder?
It should incur a Sanity roll.

What is the condition that an enemy may be reduced to?
unconsciousness

What happens when the player wins a Luck roll during a chase?
They get to define the next few locations

What happens to a player who hesitates to define the next few locations during a chase?
The Keeper should ask leading questions

What is the outcome of Harvey passing his Dodge roll and weaving through the crowd?
He weaves through the crowd with ease
